details.title: Corrections to "Challenges related to reliability in nano electronics"
details.abstract: The author makes two modifications to his original paper (see ibid., vol.55, no.4, p.569-70, Dec. 2006).

references.title: Challenges related to reliability in nano electronics

context.text: In the above paper [1], there are two modifications.

Under section heading, “Reliability and Nano Technologies” [1, p. 569], the sentence “For example, are consumers likely to be satisfied with high cost plasma TVs with an estimated 4–year expected life?” should read “For example, are consumers likely to be satisfied with high cost plasma TVs with an estimated 5-7 year expected life?”.

Under sub-section heading, “Management of the Scarcity and Secrecy of Available Data” [1, p. 570], the following two sentences are added at the end of the second paragraph from the end—The other possibility, with great challenge too, is to predict reliability using the computer-aided tools, based on the physical properties of the nano systems.

references.text: W. Kuo, "Challenges related to reliability in nano electronics", IEEE Trans. Rel., vol. 55, no. 4, pp. 569-570, Dec. 2006.
